snippet: President Obama said he would act to move resources away from the interior of the country in the face of Republican refusals to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws.
abstract: Pres Obama says he will use his executive power to make potentially sweeping changes to nation’s immigration system without Congress, acknowledging the death of his more than yearlong effort to enact compromise legislation granting legal status to 11 million immigrants here illegally; move sets the stage for particularly bitter partisan rancor over immigration that could weigh heavily on midterm elections.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and JULIA PRESTON
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Julia Preston from New York. Laura Tillman contributed reporting from McAllen, Tex.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said he would act to move resources away from the interior of the country in the face of Republican refusals to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws.

headline.main: Obama Says He’ll Order Action to Aid Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Obama Says He’ll Order Action to Aid Immigrants
